Indigenous cultures.text: Cultures of Indigenous peoples before Europeans arrived

European myths.text: Myths Europeans held about Indigenous peoples

Urbanization.text: The process of people moving from rural areas to cities, leading to the growth and expansion of cities

Tenement.text: A crowded, often poorly built apartment building where many immigrant and working-class families lived during the late 1800s and early 1900s

Child Labor.text: The practice of children working in factories, mines, or other jobs, often for long hours, low pay, and in unsafe conditions

Ellis Island.text: An immigration station in New York Harbor (opened in 1892) where millions of immigrants, mostly from Europe, were processed before entering the United States

Immigrant.text: A person who leaves their home country to live permanently in another country
